greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Möbius transform of A003557, n divided by its largest squarefree divisor.
comment: Multiplicative because A003557 is. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 27 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Multiplicative with a(p) = 0 and a(p^e) = (p-1)*p^(e-2) for prime p and e>1. - _Werner Schulte_, Sep 27 2018
Dirichlet convolution with A003958 equals A000010. - _Werner Schulte_, Sep 28 2018
Dirichlet convolution of A000010 and A097945. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 02 2020
maple: seq(add(mobius(d)*A003557(n/d), d in divisors(n)), n=1..100); # _Ridouane Oudra_, Nov 18 2019
mathematica: Table[DivisorSum[n, MoebiusMu[#] EulerPhi[#] EulerPhi[n/#] &], {n, 108}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 18 2019 *)
program: A003557(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 2] = max(0,f[i, 2]-1)); factorback(f); }; \\ From A003557
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 11 2018
